column1: Jack and Fred sat on the steps
column2: trying to think of something to do. They had spent their morning in digging wells and ditches in the sand; for it was vacation-time
column3: and they were living down by the sea.Just before dinner they had been in bathing. Since dinner they had been over in the fields
column4: picking up long feathery grasses to put in mamma's vases. And now
column5: what should they do next?At last
column6: Jack thought it would be fine fun to make a large kite
column7: much larger than any they had ever seen. Fred said he would help; and off they ran to get sticks
column12: so as to have every thing ready.When they could think of nothing else that was needed
column13: they set to work. Jack cut and tacked the sticks together
column14: just as the smaller ones were in his little old kite; while Fred cut the papers
